title: Neighbour from hell finally moves out and people next door couldn’t be happier
text:
Residents have spoken of their joy that ‘neighbour from hell’ Julie Rankine appears to finally be leaving the area (Picture: BPM)

Neighbours are overjoyed a woman who waved an axe and prodded them with her walking stick during years of harrassment is finally moving out.

Julie Rankine was named a ‘neighbour from hell’ by those living next door in her wealthy street in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham.

She has been in court twice in the last two years on charges relating to the harassment of her neighbours who say they are ‘over the moon’ her house is up for sale.

After more than a decade in the luxury five-bed property – which overlooks Sutton Park – Rankine has put her home on the market for £995,000.

Neighbours say she has made their lives a misery during her time on the street, causing sleepless nights and stress.

She last appeared at Birmingham crown court in July when she was found guilty of breaching a restraining order imposed to protect her neighbours, forbidding her to have any contact with them.

The divorced mum-of-two had been handed the order in 2017 after being convicted of harassment, including poking one neighbour with her walking stick and threatening another with an axe.

Rankine’s detached five-bedroomed property in Sutton Coldfield is now on the market for £995,000 (Picture: BPM)

In 2017, she was handed a restraining order for harassing neighbours, including poking one with her walking stick and threatening another with an axe (Picture: BPM)

She has been accused of sitting on her roof and watching neighbours in their gardens, of playing loud music and of holding parties in her outdoor swimming pool until 4am.

Rankine’s trial in July heard how one neighbour had even gone to the lengths of spending £4,000 building a gazebo so they could sit in their garden in privacy.

The court heard she ran a small business designing tea-related pottery and utensils from her house, which she got in her divorce settlement.

At one point she applied for planning permission to open a tea-room at the house and have 12 parking bays painted on her large driveway, but neighbours claimed the plans were actually a front for a brothel.

One resident – who asked not to be named – said they ‘cheered with delight’ when the For Sale sign went up.

They said: ‘When we heard the house was up for sale it was the best news we’d heard.

Rankine was back in court in July for breaching her restraining order (Picture: BPM)

‘Ever since she moved in we’ve had nothing but trouble, misery and stress. This is such a nice place to live, but our lives have been ruined by her.’

According to the estate agent’s listing, the detached house has five bedrooms – one with a balcony – two reception rooms, a cellar playroom, wet room, entertaining and games room, a self contained annexe, large garden and heated outdoor swimming pool.

Estate agents Quantrills say on RightMove: ‘This is a very impressive double-fronted period family residence, occupying a mature setting in this sought-after and convenient residential location opposite Sutton Park.’

It is unclear if Rankine is currently living at the home.

description: Julie Rankine has been in court twice in the last two years for harassing neighbours - including prodding them with her walking stick.
